#summary figue is a javascript module to cluster data and visualize clusters.

= Introduction =

figue is a javascript module to cluster data and visualize clusters.
The current version only proposes hierarchical clustering with the most common linkage techniques: single-linkage, complete-linkage and average linkage. Tree can be visualized by means of dendograms. 

For more information about hierarchical clustering please refer to.


= Details =

{{{

// Data source: LinkedIn
// Initial data are businesses that need to be clustered according to their size (nb of employees) and revenue (in mln$)

var data = [ 
    {'company': 'Microsoft' , 'size': 91259, 'incomes': 60420},
    {'company': 'IBM' , 'size': 400000, 'incomes': 98787},
    {'company': 'Skype' , 'size': 700, 'revenue': 716},
    {'company': 'SAP' , 'size': 48000, 'incomes': 11567},
    {'company': 'Yahoo!' , 'size': 14000 , 'incomes': 6426 },
    {'company': 'eBay' , 'size': 15000, 'incomes': 8700},
 ] ;

// Create the labels and the vectors

var labels = new Array ;
var vectors = new Array ;
for (var i = 0 ; i < data.length ; i++) {
    labels[i] = data[i]['company'] ;
    vectors[i] = [ data[i]['employees'] , data[i]['incomes']] ;
}

// Generate a hierarchical tree

root = figue.agglomerate(labels, vectors , figue.EUCLIDIAN_DISTANCE, figue.SIMPLE_LINKAGE) ;

// Produce the dendogram

dendogram = root.buildDendogram (5, true) ;

// Print it in a 'pre' element

var pre = document.getElementById('mypre').innerHTML = dendogram

}}}
